chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Klimowicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years 3 months bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: 15cm162

superMiscConds.notes: $2023.00 - To be paid during period of extended supervision.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
It is a condition of extended supervision that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  This may include mental health assessment and follow through. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Stay out of taverns.
Take medications as prescribed.
DNA sample ordered.
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement 
Firearm warning given.
Alcohol/drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. Random UA's at discretion of agent.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew J Klimowicz in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Matthew J Klimowicz in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Matthew J Klimowicz in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Matthew J Klimowicz in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.
Plea - NC.
BTC: GUILTY.
